intro: Crepis lodomiriensis, commonly known as the Tibetan hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a dense cluster of tubular disk flowers, typical of the genus Crepis. It is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in high-altitude ecosystems.
